初遇.encontent:
Don't panic, my lord, <The chasing troopers are also
 part of the play.>
初遇.content:
无须惊慌，老爷，【尾随着我的追兵们也是演出的一部分
。】

箱中气候.encontent:
When the rain drops, the sorrow follows. Something
 shall befall the present day.<Murder, love, or the
 eulogistic end of a story—>the dramatic rain!
箱中气候.content:
当雨落下时，愁绪也一同落下，今天一定会发生什么，【或
是谋杀，或是爱情，或是可歌可泣的终末——】戏剧化的
雨啊～！

致未来.encontent:
Future is an interesting issue, my lord. I yearn for the wheel
 of the busy stage moving forward, so do you. <My friend of one
 mind, I'll give thee a wind.>
致未来.content:
未来是个有趣的话题，老爷，我想要这热闹剧场的车轮向
前滚动，而您亦然如此。【志同道合的朋友啊，我将助你
一阵风～】

孑立.encontent:
In the ancient times, the fool's job is to entertain
 the lord ... <Dost thou also need this service?>
孑立.content:
在古代，宫廷弄臣的职责就是在君主的闲暇时刻逗他们开
心……【您也需要这项服务吗？】

问候.encontent:
The moment you step onto the stage,<it comes clear
 to me that the hero hath arrived. >
问候.content: 当您步入这剧场之时，【我便明白，主角已然登场。】

朝晨.encontent:
Greetings to you, my lord. Your arrival may be the
 reason of Master Charlie's attendance for rehearsal.
朝晨.content:
向您问好，我的老爷。不知是不是您带来的好运气，夏利
团长今天也来剧团排演了。

信任-朝晨.encontent:
<Where did they go?>They all went to work.<And?>And they went
 to church!<O? Why not go to the play? Why not sing? >Because
 long live the all mighty King!
信任-朝晨.content:
【人们去哪儿了？】人们都去工作了！【然后呢？】然后
他们去礼拜了！【哦？为什么没有人唱歌？为什么没人观
看戏剧了？】因为我们伟大的国王英武长存！

夜暮.encontent:
I wish you an engrossing dream, <leastwise there is
 no ban for dreams yet.>
夜暮.content:
祝您今夜能做个有趣的梦，【至少现在还没有颁布关于梦
的禁令～】

信任-夜暮.encontent:
<Where did they go?>They all went to pray.<And?>And they came
 to us, in front of us!<O! They still love—the entertainment,
 the song, the skin underneath the dress.>It's the arrival of
 the night! Let the play begin!
信任-夜暮.content:
【人们都去哪儿了？】人们都去祈祷了！【然后呢？】然
后他们前来了，在我们面前！【哦～他们还是热爱的，热
爱娱乐，热爱欢歌，热爱裙摆下的肌肤～】夜晚到了！拉
开序幕吧！

帽檐与发鬓.encontent:
My mask? I see not necessity of masking off. <Aren't
 thou wearing it too?>
帽檐与发鬓.content: 我的面具？我认为没有摘下它的必要。【您不也戴着吗？】

袖与手.encontent:
I picked this floweret, before it was distained by
 the blockish world.
袖与手.content: 我摘下了这朵小花，在它沾染上世俗的愚昧之前～

衣着与身形.encontent:
Are you confirming my gender? <Out alas, the Fool hath
 no gender.>
衣着与身形.content:
您这是在确认我的性别吗？【很遗憾，表演者是没有性别
的。】

嗜好.encontent:
What would you do at your leisure? For me, fishing
 perhaps, or appreciating silver utensils. I read no
 script, I have no script.
嗜好.content:
在休息时间里，您会做些什么？我想我会去钓鱼，会鉴赏
银质餐具。我不会看剧本，我没有剧本。

赞赏.encontent: Listen—audience, they shout all you forth!
赞赏.content: 向下看去吧——那如雷的掌声为您而来！

亲昵.encontent:
If none dares stand out and do something to His Grace, 
 your fair laughter, shall it be heard no more?
亲昵.content:
如果没有人站出来对那位国王做些什么，您美好的笑声，不
就再也听不见了吗？

闲谈Ⅰ.encontent:
The gallows has feet, my lord! Run away when we still
 can! He is coming! <His arrival shall kiss all's neck
 with ropes.> Hahaha!
闲谈Ⅰ.content:
绞刑架长了脚，老爷！我们最好快点逃跑！他将要来了！【他
来时就会用绳索亲吻每一个人～】哈哈哈！

闲谈Ⅱ.encontent:
Who shall stand pensive for tragedy? Who shall smile
 through tears for survival?Who shall pray for their
 bloody hands? People—It's people!
闲谈Ⅱ.content:
谁会为悲剧而哭泣？谁会为劫后余生而破涕为笑？谁会为
双手的鲜血不断祈祷？是人——是人们～！

独白.encontent:
Some please people with comic, others with wit. Me,
 with my life.
独白.content:
有人以滑稽引人发笑，有人以智慧逗人开怀，而我使用我
的生命。

战前.encontent:
Only one fool could stay on the stage, <that shall
 be me.>
战前.content: 这个舞台上只能有一个小丑，【那就是我。】

召唤至终的仪式.encontent: To that we have free souls forever!
召唤至终的仪式.content: 献给我们那永远自由的灵魂——

战斗胜利.encontent:
Haha, my lord, I defeated one thousand enemies in battle
 just now!
战斗胜利.content: 哈哈，老爷，我刚刚在这场战斗中击败了一千个敌人！

洞悉.encontent: <Sing thee a song I will,> in any voice, any way.
洞悉.content:
【我愿意为您唱一首歌作为报答】，以任何声音，任何方
式。
